<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><Highlight kind="comment">/// The RecurrenceDescriptor is used to identify recurrences variables in a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><Highlight kind="comment">/// loop. Reduction is a special case of recurrence that has uses of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><Highlight kind="comment">/// recurrence variable outside the loop. The method isReductionPHI identifies</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><Highlight kind="comment">/// reductions that are basic recurrences.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Basic recurrences are defined as the summation, product, OR, AND, XOR, min,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><Highlight kind="comment">/// or max of a set of terms. For example: for(i=0; i&lt;n; i++) &#123; total +=</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><Highlight kind="comment">/// array&#91;i&#93;; &#125; is a summation of array elements. Basic recurrences are a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><Highlight kind="comment">/// special case of chains of recurrences (CR). See ScalarEvolution for CR</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><Highlight kind="comment">/// references.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><Highlight kind="comment">/// This struct holds information about recurrence variables.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/recurrencedescriptor"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/recurrencedescriptor/#a5e9a6d9348306b3d62804dac54e358a7">RecurrenceDescriptor</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="188"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Returns true if Phi is a reduction in TheLoop. The RecurrenceDescriptor</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="189"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// is returned in RedDes. If either \\p DB is non-null or \\p AC and \\p DT are</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="190"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// non-null, the minimal bit width needed to compute the reduction will be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="191"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// computed. If \\p SE is non-null, store instructions to loop invariant</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="192"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// addresses are processed.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="193"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="197"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="198"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Returns true if Phi is a fixed-order recurrence. A fixed-order recurrence</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="199"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// is a non-reduction recurrence relation in which the value of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="200"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// recurrence in the current loop iteration equals a value defined in a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// previous iteration (e.g. if the value is defined in the previous</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="202"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// iteration, we refer to it as first-order recurrence, if it is defined in</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="203"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the iteration before the previous, we refer to it as second-order</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="204"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// recurrence and so on). Note that this function optimistically assumes that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="205"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// uses of the recurrence can be re-ordered if necessary and users need to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="206"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// check and perform the re-ordering.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="207"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/recurrencedescriptor/#a203487323e0aa341b6c24f9ef20b5909">isFixedOrderRecurrence</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/phinode">PHINode</a> &#42;Phi, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loop">Loop</a> &#42;TheLoop,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="208"><Highlight kind="normal">                                     <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/dominatortree">DominatorTree</a> &#42;DT);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00354" /><CodeLine lineNumber="354"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Returns true if \\p Phi is an induction in the loop \\p L. If \\p Phi is an</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00355" /><CodeLine lineNumber="355"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// induction, the induction descriptor \\p D will contain the data describing</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00356" /><CodeLine lineNumber="356"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// this induction. Since Induction Phis can only be present inside loop</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00357" /><CodeLine lineNumber="357"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// headers, the function will assert if it is passed a Phi whose parent is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00358" /><CodeLine lineNumber="358"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// not the loop header. If by some other means the caller has a better SCEV</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00359" /><CodeLine lineNumber="359"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// expression for \\p Phi than the one returned by the ScalarEvolution</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00361" /><CodeLine lineNumber="361"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// associated with the phi includes casts (that we know we can ignore</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00362" /><CodeLine lineNumber="362"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// under proper runtime checks), they are passed through \\p CastsToIgnore.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00373" /><CodeLine lineNumber="373"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00374" /><CodeLine lineNumber="374"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Returns true if \\p Phi is a loop \\p L induction, in the context associated</Highlight></CodeLine>
